title: AVP, Network Access
description:
The WelbeHealth PACE program helps seniors stay in their homes and communities by providing all-inclusive medical care and community-based services. We serve the most vulnerable seniors with better quality and compassion in a value-based model.



The AVP, Network Access will be accountable for providing optimal access to care and an outstanding network partner experience across WelbeHealth PACE, nationally. This dynamic leader will champion a unique approach to network contracting and payment operations in accordance with core principles of the PACE philosophy, and that is scalable and replicable across diverse regions, market dynamics, and service types. This includes designing, building, and sustaining compliant, multi-state networks and payment operations in support of enterprise goals for patient experience and quality care.


**Essential Job Duties:**


* Accountable for network access and quality, as well as payments processing and plan operations performance
* Design and actualize a national network development strategy, oversee highly elaborate executive negotiations, engage in strategic business development efforts, and develop required infrastructure to support multi-state high-quality networks, to ensure access across all WelbeHealth programs
* Exceed key performance indicators through a network and plan operations model that delivers appropriate balance of local-first approach with scale, compliance, satisfaction, financial outcomes, and consistency
* Champion a provider service-centric approach, with an ownership mindset toward delivering a seamless experience that drives value
* Develop strategic initiatives to drive participant census growth and sustained enrollment through unique and high-quality delivery models
* Cultivate and guide a high-performance team known for consistency of meeting goals, partnering cross-functionally, and individual/team satisfaction


**Job Requirements:**


* Bachelor’s degree in relevant field, professional experience may be substituted
* Master’s degree preferred
* Minimum of eight (8) years leading in value-based care or managed care, with some direct exposure to network contracting, health plan operations, and overseeing teams
* Minimum of two (2) years of supervisory experience with demonstrated experience mentoring and developing team members
* Demonstrated comprehension of intricate market dynamics and synthesizing into impactful strategy benefitting the patient
* Experience scaling highly elaborate and regulated operations, preferably in the value-based care setting.
* Knowledge of payor/ provider dynamics


**Benefits of Working at WelbeHealth:** Apply your expertise in new ways as we rapidly expand. You will have the opportunity to design the way we work in the context of an encouraging and loving environment where every person feels uniquely cared for.


* 401k + employer match
* Medical insurance coverage (Medical, Dental, Vision) starting day one of employment
* Work life balance – we mean it! 17 days of personal time off (PTO), 12 holidays observed annually, sick time
* And additional benefits


Salary/Wage base range for this role is $204,363 - $255,454 / year + Bonus + Equity. WelbeHealth offers competitive total rewards package that includes, 401k match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Actual pay will be adjusted based on experience and other qualifications.


Compensation
$204,363—$255,454 USD


**COVID-19 Vaccination Policy**



At WelbeHealth, our mission is to unlock the full potential of our vulnerable seniors. In this spirit, please note that we have a vaccination policy for all our employees and proof of vaccination, or a vaccine declination form will be required prior to employment. WelbeHealth maintains required infection control and PPE standards and has requirements relevant to all team members regarding vaccinations.





**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion**



At WelbeHealth, we embrace and cherish the diversity of our team members, and we're committed to building a culture of inclusion and belonging. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. People seeking employment at WelbeHealth are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information or characteristics (or those of a family member), pregnancy or other status protected by applicable law.





**Beware of Scams**



Please ensure your application is being submitted through a WelbeHealth sponsored site only. Our emails will come from @welbehealth.com email addresses. You will never be asked to purchase your own employment equipment. You can report suspected scam activity to fraud.report@welbehealth.com

title: R&D Technician
description:
Overview:

Bruker OST is a pioneer in the development and commercial supply of superconducting wire and cable. Located in Carteret, NJ, we are a rapidly growing manufacturing company in the high technology sector with a strong track record of stability and success. We maintain an active development program for both low and high temperature superconductors. Our customers include government agencies with primary applications in fusion energy and high energy physics, as well as private industries around the world for medical, pharmaceutical, and industrial applications. We have earned the leading market share in commercial superconductor markets by delivering quality products on reliable schedules with superior technical performance.
Responsibilities:
* Assisting R&D Engineers with the development of new wire products.
* Job responsibilities are on the wire manufacturing floor and include wire drawing and process development, including the ability to create tools & methods to take a product from the experimental to production state.
* Participating in the planning and analysis of experiments
* Assisting the production department with special projects as needed.


Qualifications:
* Machine operation background
* Basic math and computer skills
* Some mechanical skills preferred
* The ability to perform occasional heavy physical work, including lifting 50 pounds
* Previous experience working with metals, machining, and chemical handling preferred
* Self motivated and mechanically creative
* Attention to detail.
* Good organizational and communication skills
* Ability to work independently and collaborate within a team.
* Technical high school diploma or Associate’s degree
* 2-3 years Electronics, Mechanical or Chemical background preferred
* Some overtime may be required

  

Bruker Corporation offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including medical, dental, 401(k), paid vacation, holidays, and tuition assistance (as applicable).  

Bruker is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics
company_description: Bruker Corporation is a manufacturer of scientific instruments for molecular and materials research, as well as for industrial and applied analysis.

title: Research Portfolio Analyst
description:
Posted
**August 2024**Location
**New York City/ Hybrid**
Status
**Full time, Regular, Exempt**
Reports to
**Director of Research Operations**  

  

**Organization**


Founded in 1968, the Guttmacher Institute is a global leader in advancing sexual and reproductive health and rights. Through a unique and interrelated program of high-quality research, evidence-based advocacy and strategic communications, the Institute works to generate new ideas, encourage enlightened public debate, and promote sound policy and program development; its overarching goal is to ensure the highest standard of sexual and reproductive health and rights for all people worldwide. The Institute is engaged in building a more inclusive, transparent and equitable organization.  



**Position summary**


A Research Portfolio Analyst monitors the progress of research activities for a portfolio of projects, programs, and initiatives, identifying and facilitating the resolution of problems that have a significant impact on the overall goals of the Research Division. Under the direction of the Director of Research Operations, the Research Portfolio Analyst works in close collaboration with the project team to monitor the successful execution of a portfolio of proposals and awards that are diverse in scope. A Research Portfolio Analyst maximizes efficiency and smooth workflows to ensure that workplans are executed per funding, scientific, and/or regulatory specifications. They ensure that the conduct of work integrates with the Institute’s broader administrative processes and best practices, including by ensuring timely communication about project updates and with key internal and external stakeholders. A Research Portfolio Analyst will contribute to a range of administrative and institutional activities on one or more projects or project components during pre-award and post-award phases.  



**Responsibilities**


*Administrative duties:*


* Support the forecasting, planning, and managing a portfolio of projects and programs, including by monitoring the timely accomplishment of project management tasks, in collaboration with the Research Administrative Team, Research Directors, and project/program team leads.
* Develop and maintain records of project and program progress, and prepare periodic and ad hoc reports (e.g., monthly fiscal reports, workplan progress reports, staffing allocation and percent time effort reports), as required by the Research Management Team, Development team, Finance team, and other regulatory bodies, among others.
* Monitor and support coordination of administrative tasks (e.g., budget development and tracking, consultant and subcontractor schedules, invoice review and approval for payment) requiring input from multiple stakeholders internal or external to the project/program team and/or to the Institute.
* Identify and/or coordinate responses to funding opportunities between project/program teams and Development to ensure timely submission of proposals, including supporting budget monitoring and reporting.
* Monitor and ensure regulatory and compliance requirements are met, in collaboration with the Institute’s compliance officer.
* Serve as liaison between project and program teams and relevant internal units (e.g., research administration, Finance, Human Resources, IT, Development, Enterprise Project management Office) to ensure that projects are appropriately resourced and follow organizational procedures and best practices.
* Act as liaison between Institute teams and external stakeholders (consultants, sub-contractors, international partners), including by monitoring communications to ensure internal and external stakeholders remain informed about project/program status, and needs, including regulatory and reporting requirements.
* Monitor and communicate with division and Institute decision-makers about project/program human resources needs to ensure timely staff recruitment, onboarding, offboarding, and evolution of staff effort allocations.
* Monitor and ensure coordination of activities between the scientific, communication, and policy teams.
* Monitor reporting requirements to ensure timely preparation of programmatic and funder reports for internal and external audiences and for audits.
* Monitor compliance with the storage, archiving and/or disposal of project documents, data, and other related materials.

*Project-level tasks:*


* Provide administrative support to project leads, program managers, project managers, project coordinators, and other study team leaders.
* Monitor study procedures to ensure appropriate documentation and compliance with data security, data management, and confidentiality standards.
* Monitor and ensure the development and execution of staff training, such as required by funders, the IRB, or other relevant areas.
* Monitor and ensure quality control for project activities.
* Create, give input to, and monitor a pipeline of information on project health issues and risks with the EPMO.
* Other duties, as assigned.

  

**Qualifications**


* Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
* Ability to interact positively and constructively with diverse individuals and teams
* Experience with research administration, research coordination and/or project management
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to multi-task, prioritize, track activities, and effectively manage time and competing deadlines
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills
* Self-motivated and able to adapt to change while working under stressful circumstances
* Ability to operate all standard office equipment and software including MS Office
* Ability to use, or learn to use, multiple software systems for communication, tracking and management, including Asana, Questica, Slack
* Experience with research grant management in the population sciences strongly desired. Ability to plan ahead, foresee issues, and develop appropriate risk mitigation plans
* Demonstrates a high degree of professionalism
* 3-5 years of progressively responsible related work experience in research administration or another relevant field.

  

**Salary and benefits**


The starting salary for this position is $78,501 to $121,702 and will be commensurate with experience. This is a union-represented position. The Guttmacher Institute practices a hybrid work schedule, requiring in-office attendance 8 days per month at our NYC location. We offer excellent benefits, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance; vacation, personal, and sick time; paid parental leave; tuition reimbursement; commuting subsidy; and a 401(k) plan with employer match. The range for this position is specific to New York, but base pay may vary depending on a wide range of factors, including experience, skill sets, and training. The Guttmacher Institute strives to provide the training and support staff need to be successful in their positions and to grow professionally.


The Guttmacher Institute seeks to foster a diverse, inclusive and equitable environment, wall employee’s unique talents are valued and recognized as an asset to the achievement of our mission. The Guttmacher Institute is an equal opportunity employer. Guttmacher Institute tries to make employment opportunities accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact HR at (212) 248-1111 or **recruitment@guttmacher.org****.**



**How to Apply**


 submit resume and cover letter
Please note that telephone inquiries will not be acknowledged. No agencies, please.


Guttmacher is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer


The Guttmacher Institute seeks to foster a diverse, inclusive and equitable work environment, wemployees’ talents are valued and recognized as an asset to the achievement of our mission. We endeavor to make the application process accessible to all users. If you need assistance learning about or applying to our employment opportunities, please contact our human resources department at (212) 248-1111 or **recruitment@guttmacher.org**.

title: Die Room Technician -Second Shift
description:
Overview:

Bruker OST has a great direct hire position in Carteret, NJ. This position offers competitive compensation, growth potential and a positive team environment.  

Why Bruker? Because, at Bruker you oversee your career, with access to cutting edge projects and technologies in an industry leading organization. We manufacture the superconducting wire commonly used in healthcare and scientific instrumentation, particularly in the field of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) magnets. These are used for big science projects like the Large Hadron Collider at Cern, Switzerland.  

In this position you will Maintain and clean dies and other tools from production and quickly turn them around for production. **Hours-3:00pm-11:30pm Training will be on 1st shift 7:00am-3:30pm.** **Click Here to Learn about Bruker EST**
Responsibilities:
**Essential Functions*** Complete accurate documentation and record keeping on production operator logs.
* Maintain and track die room inventory using computer software or Excel spreadsheet and 6S tools to prevent run outs and defective items.
* Comply with company safety standards and procedures.
* Track die failures for process engineer to determine root cause and improve the die design and drawing process.
* Ensures safe working practices are being followed.
* Participates Bruker OST’s on-boarding efforts by participating in activities that supports the training of others
* Actively engages with quality and process engineers to assist and implement operational changes in compliance with established MSI standards.


Qualifications:
* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Must have basic math and computer skills (e.g., Microsoft Excel).
* Eligible to work in the USA
* Manufacturing experience preferred
* Ability to read and interpret procedures and calibrated equipment.
* Ability to read and understand all safety operating procedures and to use all safety features and equipment.


Other Requirements  

PHYSICAL
On the job the employee must:

title: Machine Operator - Second Shift
description:
Overview:

Bruker OST produces superconducting wire for the medical and scientific industries. Our products enable MRI machines that help diagnose medical conditions in hospitals and clinics around the world and are also vital components in some of the largest global scientific experimental devices such as particle accelerators for high energy physics research, and tokamaks for fusion energy research. **Schedule****3pm to 11:30pm****Monday-Friday**  

Click Here to Learn about Bruker EST
Responsibilities:
* Complete accurate documentation and record keeping on production operator logs.
* Ensure all assigned machines are operating safely, efficiently and reliably, according to recommended operating guidelines(MSIs) via performing necessary mechanical adjustments
* Comply with company safety standards and procedures.
* Informs maintenance team of any needed machine repairs or concerns.
* Performs preventative maintenance on all the machines within respective workstations.
* Ensures safe working practices are being followed.
* Participates Bruker OST’s on-boarding efforts by participating in activities that supports the training of others
* Actively engages with quality and process engineers to assist and implement operational changes in compliance with established MSI standards.
* Ability to troubleshoot mechanical or process issues accordingly
* Performs regular quality control throughout the shift and visual quality checks
* Employs problem solving and root cause analysis skills to assist with the corrective action process.
* Performs necessary pre-operation activities to ensure proper equipment start up on multiple pieces of equipment.
* Operate/monitor multiple pieces of equipment to ensure quality production and minimal unplanned stops


Qualifications:
**Qualifications:*** High School Diploma or equivalent
* Eligible to work in the USA
* Manufacturing experience preferred
* Ability to communicate in English
* Ability to read and interpret procedures and calibrated equipment.
* Ability to read and understand all safety operating procedures and to use all safety features and equipment.

  

Bruker Corporation offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including medical, dental, 401(k), paid vacation, holidays, and tuition assistance (as applicable).

title: Chemical Cleaning Technician- Third Shift
description:
Overview:
**About Bruker EST:** Bruker EST is a leading provider of advanced scientific instruments and solutions for molecular and materials research, as well as for industrial and applied analysis. With a commitment to innovation and quality, Bruker EST serves a diverse range of industries, including pharmaceuticals, biotechnology, chemistry, and materials science  

In our business of manufacturing superconducting wire, our Chemical Cleaning Technicians are responsible for performing a variety of jobs relating to the preparation of chemical batches as well as the chemical etch cleaning of a variety of components used in making superconducting wire. Successful candidates must be able to closely follow written work instructions and complete manufacturing process documentation.  

At Bruker OST we put safety first, and we are proud of our ISO 45001 occupational health and safety international certification. We have a thorough training program for new hires. As the job duties require working with hazardous chemicals, including acid based products , employees are required and must be comfortable wearing – a full protective Tyvek suit, safety glasses, a splash face shield, and gloves. Technicians in this position are responsible for maintaining the highest safety and quality standards when performing any task. **Schedule: 11pm to 7:30am****Starting Rate: $21**  


Responsibilities:
* Follow all safety regulations as stated in the OST Safety Manual.
* Proficiently use measuring tools such as micrometers and calipers
* Assisting in the assembly of etch cleaned parts in a clean room
* Assist in development and revision of etch cleaning procedures as needed
* Maintain well organized manufacturing paperwork
* Support and help improve our Lean manufacturing practices
* Work comfortably as part of a team on some tasks, and work comfortably with minimal supervision at other times
* Need to be capable of lifting 50 pounds
* Working safely with 55-gallon drum quantities of acids and chemicals in a manufacturing environment
* Utilizing good math skills to keep track of chemical mixing and etch cleaning processes
* Be familiar with risks associated with hazardous chemicals and how to work safely with same
* Working overtime as the production schedule requires


Qualifications:
* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Eligible to work in the USA
* Manufacturing experience preferred
* Ability to communicate in English
* Ability to read and interpret procedures and calibrated equipment.
* Ability to read and understand all safety operating procedures and to use all safety features and equipment.


Bruker Corporation offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including medical, dental, 401(k), paid vacation, holidays, and tuition assistance (as applicable).  

Bruker is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: HR Generalist
description:
Posted
**June 2024**Location
**New York City/Hybrid**
Status
**Full Time, Regular, Exempt**
Reports to
**Director of Human Resources**
Organization:
Founded in 1968, the Guttmacher Institute is a global leader in advancing sexual and reproductive health and rights. Through a unique and interrelated program of research, policy analysis and public education, the Institute works to generate new ideas, encourage enlightened public debate and promote sound policy and program development. The Institute’s overarching goal is to ensure the highest standard of sexual and reproductive health and rights for all people worldwide.


**Position Summary:**


The Human Resources Generalist is responsible for performing human resources (HR)-related duties on a professional level and works closely with the Director of Human Resources to ensure smooth daily operations of the HR department. This role focuses on talent acquisition and recruitment but also encompasses a wide range of generalist responsibilities including on-boarding, employee engagement, compensation and benefits administration, compliance, and HRIS management.

  


**Responsibilities:**


Recruitment and Hiring:


* Manage the full recruitment process for entry to mid-level positions, including drafting job descriptions and position announcements, meeting with hiring managers to clarify qualifications, screening criteria, and staffing needs in advance of required start dates.
* Lead recruitment efforts utilizing web-based job boards, social media, and other posting outlets; manage internet recruiting accounts and pre-employment testing services; ensure compliance with local, Federal, and State guidelines for job postings and advertisements.
* Conduct initial applicant screens, interviews, reference checks, and background checks; present qualified candidates to hiring managers for further consideration.
* Schedule and conduct interviews via MS Outlook, Zoom, Teams, and in person when necessary.
* Perform pre-employment checks and ensure compliance with all screening processes.
* Respond in writing to all applicants, including declined candidates; prepare offer letters, wage notices, and maintain applicant records.
* Under the direction of the Director of Human Resources, determine competitive salary offers; communicate and negotiate offers of employment with selected candidates.
* Support and facilitate onboarding and offboarding processes for employees, ensuring a smooth transition into and out of the organization.


**Employee Engagement and Relations:**


* Provide support to employees in various HR-related topics such as leaves and compensation and resolve any issues that may arise
* Create and implement employee engagement activities and events to foster a positive workplace culture and improve employee morale.
* Recommend improvements for employee retention and engagement initiatives.


**Compliance and Administration:**


* Manage the department’s HRIS Recruitment system, ADP Workforce Now; conduct audits, run routine and ad hoc reports, troubleshoot problems, and maintain the integrity of the data housed in the system.
* Analyze HRIS reports to track employment/hiring statistics such as vacancy, turnover, time-to-fill, etc.
* Assist in completing compliance reporting (i.e., EEO-1 reports), census reports, and external salary and benefit surveys.
* Maintain compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommend best practices; review policies and practices to maintain compliance.
* Manage DEI and EEO activities including ATS tracking of all recruitment activities, external hiring, and internal transfers/promotions to ensure complete, auditable information that follows government regulations is on file.
* Assist in the preparation and processing of departmental billing/invoices.
* Assume additional responsibilities as assigned by the Director of Human Resources and HR Managers.


**Qualifications and Requirements**


We recognize that strong candidates may not have every qualification listed and encourage applications from individuals who bring passion, skills, and experience in many or most of these areas.


* Passion for and experience with work to advance sexual and reproductive health, rights, and justice.
* Seven years of relevant experience in Human Resources, Recruiting, or Talent Acquisition.
* Experience recruiting and staffing in the non-profit sector preferred.
* Experience with professional job boards and recruiting software such as Indeed or LinkedIn.
* Proficiency managing and using an HRIS; experience with ADP Workforce Now strongly preferred. Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
* Strong organizational and project management skills, including knowledge of Asana, to help achieve goals and deadlines.
* Excellent customer service skills and the ability to work with all levels of staff; must demonstrate initiative and good judgment.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and familiarity with COBRA, ERISA, FMLA, and related state and federal regulations required, knowledge of payroll regulations, policies, and procedures a plus.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; knowledge of HR programs to help create efficiencies.
* Demonstrates a high degree of professionalism, accuracy, attention to detail, and monitors own work to ensure quality.
* Ability to appropriately handle and process confidential and sensitive information.
* Strong and effective time management skills.
* Highly dependable and punctual.
* Ability to travel to meetings and to the DC office on occasion.

  




**Salary and benefits**


The starting salary for this position is $86,000 to $133,925 and will be commensurate with experience. This is a non-union position. The Guttmacher Institute practices a hybrid work schedule, requiring in-office attendance 8 days per month at our NYC location. We offer excellent benefits, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance; vacation, personal, and sick time; paid parental leave; tuition reimbursement; commuting subsidy; and a 401(k) plan with employer match. The range for this position is specific to New York and DC, but base pay may vary depending on a wide range of factors, including experience, skill sets, and training. The Guttmacher Institute strives to provide the training and support staff need to be successful in their positions and to grow professionally.

  


The Guttmacher Institute seeks to foster a diverse, inclusive and equitable environment, wall employee’s unique talents are valued and recognized as an asset to the achievement of our mission. The Guttmacher Institute is an equal opportunity employer. Guttmacher Institute tries to make employment opportunities accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact HR at (212) 248-1111 or **recruitment@guttmacher.org****.**



**How to Apply**


 submit resume and cover letter
Please note that telephone inquiries will not be acknowledged. No agencies, please.


Guttmacher is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer


The Guttmacher Institute seeks to foster a diverse, inclusive and equitable work environment, wemployees’ talents are valued and recognized as an asset to the achievement of our mission. We endeavor to make the application process accessible to all users. If you need assistance learning about or applying to our employment opportunities, please contact our human resources department at (212) 248-1111 or **recruitment@guttmacher.org**.

title: Editor
description:
Posted
**May 2024**Location
**New York City/Hybrid**
Status
**Full Time, Regular, Exempt**
Reports to
**Director of Editing**
Organization
Founded in 1968, the Guttmacher Institute is a global leader in advancing sexual and reproductive health and rights. Through a unique and interrelated program of high-quality research, evidence-based advocacy and strategic communications, the Institute works to generate new ideas, encourage enlightened public debate, and promote sound policy and program development; its overarching goal is to ensure the highest standard of sexual and reproductive health and rights for all people worldwide. The Institute is engaged in building a more inclusive, transparent and equitable organization.


Position summary


The Editor will play a critical role within a team dedicated to producing high-quality, public-facing materials that present complex data and analysis on global and US sexual and reproductive health and rights. This role involves editing a diverse range of products, including research reports, policy analyses, fact sheets, presentation materials, social media content, infographics, staff communications and fundraising materials. The ideal candidate will be comfortable engaging substantively with text, tables and figures containing statistical data; their expert editing skills and understanding of our subject matter will help them ensure the accuracy and effectiveness of content and assist authors in developing strong, cohesive arguments.


Responsibilities:


* Perform substantive editing to refine and clarify text.
* Collaborate with authors and graphic designers to ensure that visuals are accurate, engaging and appropriate for target audiences.
* Help project teams conceptualize upcoming products by advising them on content type, tone and structure, ensuring planned products align with audience needs, project objectives and internal guidance.
* Employ project management principles to help guide content through editing, review, design, translation and publication, maintaining clear communication about processes, project status and deadlines.
* Write content, as needed.
* Contribute to the creation and dissemination of internal process documentation and guidelines.
* Undertake additional related tasks and projects, as needed.

  




Qualifications:


* Minimum of four years of experience in editing academic, scientific or professional communications materials.
* Exceptional writing, editing and proofreading skills, with meticulous attention to detail.
* Strong understanding of social science research methods and statistics, sufficient to ensure the accuracy of text and graphics and translate complex concepts for nonexpert audiences.
* Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel; familiarity with Microsoft 365, Asana (or similar project management tools), Zotero and Adobe Suite. Openness to learning new software as required.
* Project management experience with excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Capable of managing multiple time-sensitive priorities.
* Background knowledge in sexual and reproductive health and rights and experience in UX/UI design and social media content creation preferred.
* Demonstrated cultural competency and a commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace environment.
* Fluency in French or Spanish is highly beneficial.

Salary and Benefits


Starting salary at $80,886 to $128,949 commensurate with experience. Excellent benefits that include medical, dental, vision and life insurance; vacation, personal and sick time, paid parental leave; tuition reimbursement; commuting subsidy; and 401(k) with employer match. The range for this position is specific to New York and DC, however base pay may vary depending on a wide range of factors, including, but not limited to, experience, skill sets, and training. The Guttmacher Institute strives to provide the training and support staff need to be successful in their positions and to grow professionally.

  


The Guttmacher Institute seeks to foster a diverse, inclusive and equitable environment, wevery employee’s unique talents are valued and recognized as an asset to the achievement of our mission. The Guttmacher Institute is an equal opportunity employer.

 submit resume and cover letter
Please note that telephone inquiries will not be acknowledged. No agencies, please.

We endeavor to make the application process accessible to all users. If you need assistance learning about or applying to our employment opportunities, please contact our human resources department at (212) 248-1111 or **recruitment@guttmacher.org**.

title: Director of Superconducting Technology
description:
Overview:

Bruker OST manufactures highly specialized, engineered superconducting materials as a Tier 1 supplier to the healthcare industry. The Director of Technology will apply knowledge and expertise to prioritize and lead new superconductor product development efforts, supplier development projects, new product introductions, and escalated troubleshooting and root cause and corrective action activities. As a senior executive, the Director of Technology will also contribute to strategy development, financial models, and planning, and addressing other requirements of the business as needed.
Responsibilities:
**Strategic**

* Prioritize and lead technology and product development programs in low temperature superconductor Nb-Ti and Nb3Sn systems.
* Interface with customers and suppliers to build relationships and resolve technical issues related to the manufacturing, cost, and use of our products.
* Support other business functions as required to meet customer requirements and business objectives.
* Maintain and manage to departmental budget.
* Develop technical staff and manage performance and succession planning.
* Seek and obtain external funding in support of our new product initiatives.

 **Tactical**

* Creation and management of short-, mid-, and long-term goals and objectives
* Conduct business review meetings with key stakeholders to assess risk, review future strategies, and identify potential new product, cost down, and improvement opportunities.
* Establish and maintain close and effective working relationships with other managers within BEST.
* Establish and maintain relationships with key customers, suppliers, and collaborators.

 **Strategic**

* Development of new technologies or products to meet stakeholder expectations, primarily as measured by market share and financial measures such as gross margin and cost of quality.
* IP generation, including patent applications.
* Customer satisfaction that our product development path is in line with their needs, as measured by external funding and technical collaborations.
* Evidence of strategic planning and implementation.

 **Tactical**

* Practicality and efficacy of proposals.
* Commonality of processes and components.
* Collaboration with key persons to ensure clarity of the specifications and expectations of the company.

  


Qualifications:
* Ph.D. in materials science, physics, or a related discipline is required, as is experience in applied superconductivity.
* A proven record of new technology and product development with experience, including publications in peer-reviewed technical literature.
* A candidate with extensive superconductor development and manufacturing experience in a lean manufacturing environment would be ideal.
* Given that this is a senior role, at least 10 years of technical and/or operational management experience would be expected. (This would be typical, although this is dependant on the scope of previous jobs and the track record of the candidate.)
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to distil information and data from multiple sources, to create a focus on root cause resolution of complex problems.
* Ability to develop and manage long term and high-level plans, but also to work with pace and in detail in a hands-on manner as needed to resolve pressing technical and tactical business issues.
* Facilitator skills e.g., leading cross functional teams / problem solving and diagnostic skills etc.
* Development and performance management through teams and individuals, particularly within a matrixed organization.
* Willingness to travel globally, occasionally, and sometimes frequently as needs arise
* Willingness to engage with coworkers at all organizational levels and be willing and able to work “hands on” from time to time and as necessary to develop deep understanding of our products and processes to help inform development, improvement, and troubleshooting activities.

  

Bruker is a federal contractor and subject to Executive Order 14042. Under Executive Order 14042, all employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (with limited exceptions for those employees who are unable to be vaccinated due to a medical condition or a sincerely held religious belief). You will need to provide proof of vaccination by submitting a copy of your CDC COVID-19 Vaccination Record Card to Bruker, or obtain areligious or medical exemption, as a condition of employment.  

Bruker Corporation offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including medical, dental, 401(k), paid vacation, holidays, and tuition assistance (as applicable).  

Bruker is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics  

Certain positions at Bruker require compliance with export control laws and as a result, all interviewed candidates for all positions will be screened pre-interview to determine their eligibility in light of export control restrictions.

title: Supply Chain Director
description:
Overview:
**Role overview:** Bruker OST manufactures highly specialized, engineered metallic materials as a Tier 1 supplier to the healthcare industry. Most of our supply chain spend is with suppliers who themselves are producers of highly specialized, engineered metals. The Director of Supply Chain is responsible for leading the procurement, warehouse, and logistics teams, and working collaboratively with counterparts within the BEST group. The Director of Supply Chain will apply knowledge and expertise to drive the business in supplier strategy development, supply security, tender execution, contract negotiation, and performance evaluation.


The Director of Supply Chain will work within the BEST group to support centralized sourcing and procurement efforts. The Director of Supply Chain will also establish relationships with senior business leaders to ensure that supply chain activities are aligned with their objectives, and to enlist their support (and some level of their resources) in participating in supply base improvement efforts. This will include working with the internal stakeholder from initial need identification to final goods or service delivery to meet stakeholder needs. As a senior executive, the Director of Technology will also contribute to strategy development, financial models, and planning, and addressing other requirements of the business as needed.
Responsibilities:
**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

**Strategic**

* Develop sourcing, procurement, warehousing, and logistics activities that support key business unit objectives.
* Ensure the execution of business unit and group procurement and logistics strategies to ensure consistent and high-quality value delivery.
* Maintain strong working relationships with strategic suppliers to assure cost, quality, and delivery targets are met.
* Update procurement and logistics strategies based on changing market conditions.

 **Tactical**

* Creation and management of short-, mid-, and long-term goals and objectives
* Conduct business review meetings with key stakeholders to assess risk, review future strategies, and identify potential cost down and improvement opportunities.
* Ensure the execution of standards, controls, policies, procedures, and performance metrics to manage the acquisition, reporting, and forecasting of supplier spend.
* Lead rigorous and objective contract negotiations with key internal stakeholders, legal department, and support groups.
* Control spend and build a culture of long-term saving on procurement and logistics costs.
* Establish and maintain supplier agreements with key suppliers.
* Establish and maintain close and effective working relationships with other managers.
* Leadership of cross-functional project teams across other business units, business functions, and initiatives

 **Staffing**

* Management and mentoring (via direct and dotted line reporting) of supply chain staff in (and across) sourcing, contracting, transactional purchasing, supplier management, warehousing and logistics, and miscellaneous internal procurement support activities.
* Developing the skills and competencies of procurement staff, including training development and knowledge management capabilities

 **INDICATIVE PERFORMANCE MEASURES**

**Strategic**

* Evidence of strategic planning and implementation
* Implementation of best practices in procurement and supplier management and logistics to support commercial and operational objectives.
* Continuous improvement of supplier performance: delivery, quality, cost
* Evidence of market intelligence capabilities within the key markets and suppliers to support strategy development purposes.

 **Tactical**

* Practicality and efficacy of proposals
* Commonality of processes and components
* Development, sustainability, and continuous improvement of benchmarks and scorecards to be used for supplier assessment and improvement.
* Institute policies and procedures for collecting and reporting key supplier spend and total cost of ownership metrics to reduce overall cost and improve operational effectiveness.
* Foresee alterations in the comparative negotiating ability of suppliers.
* Expect unfavorable events through analysis of data and prepare control strategies accordingly.
* Perform risk management for supply contracts and agreements.
* Identification and realization of cost-saving and cost-reduction opportunities
* Collaboration with key persons to ensure clarity of the specifications and expectations of the company.

 **Staffing**

* Minimised staffing issues and maintain high morale.


Qualifications:
**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:**

* Experience with purchasing and use of highly specialized, engineered materials.
* Solid operational management and general business skills and savvy
* Financially astute, able to assimilate detail and identify key issues quickly - understanding their impact on tactics and strategy.
* Familiarity with relevant legislative and regulatory requirements, as well as understanding of standard contractual terms and conditions to mitigate legal risk
* Knowledge of enterprise risk management and business continuity planning
* Strategic mindset and problem-solving skills
* Analytical mindset, but also creativity to seek, encourage and find non-traditional approaches
* Industry knowledge in terms of broad industry dynamics on both the buy- and sell-sides, but also the internal knowledge and “language of the business”
* Aptitude in decision-making and working with numbers
* Development and performance management through teams and individuals, particularly within a matrixed organization.
* Adept negotiator, internally & externally. Strong negotiation skills to use for large commercial deals.
* Talent in networking (evidence of establishing credibility is required)

 **EDUCATIONAL/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:**

* Bruker OST manufactures highly specialized, engineered metallic materials as a Tier 1 supplier to the healthcare industry. Most of our supply chain spend is with suppliers who themselves are producers of highly specialized, engineered metals. It is anticipated that to be effective in this role, a minimum of a Master’s degree, and preferably a Ph.D., in a discipline such as metallurgical engineering, materials science and engineering, mechanical engineering, physics, or related areas of technical specialization, is required. An MBA would also be an asset.
* For this senior role, at least 10 years of senior supply management, finance, or operational management experience would be expected. (This would be typical, although this is dependant on the scope of previous jobs and the skills/education of the candidate.)
* Alternatively, or in addition to supply chain, finance, and/or operations experience, a successful candidate could also come from the “sell-side” of a large business segment (i.e., someone who was on “the other side of the negotiating table”).
* A proven track record of delivering large savings and other value to large swaths of spend.
* Experience working in technical manufacturing environment (engineering or science).
* Exposure to, awareness of, and empathy with other cultures, diversity, and business environments.
* Willingness to travel globally, occasionally to sometimes often.

  

Bruker is a federal contractor and subject to Executive Order 14042. Under Executive Order 14042, all employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (with limited exceptions for those employees who are unable to be vaccinated due to a medical condition or a sincerely held religious belief). You will need to provide proof of vaccination by submitting a copy of your CDC COVID-19 Vaccination Record Card to Bruker, or obtain areligious or medical exemption, as a condition of employment.  

Bruker Corporation offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including medical, dental, 401(k), paid vacation, holidays, and tuition assistance (as applicable).  

Bruker is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics  

Certain positions at Bruker require compliance with export control laws and as a result, all interviewed candidates for all positions will be screened pre-interview to determine their eligibility in light of export control restrictions.
